intro: Calyptrostegia linoides, commonly known as the woolly spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically pink or white, and bloom in spring. Calyptrostegia linoides is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
